I remember VCR's, I grew up teaching boomers how to operate them when I was like 10. Slp was the highest quality record time, it was so complicated just to set up the VCR to record regular broadcast programs. Both VCR and cable provider had to be turned on and to the channel you wanted to watch, go in set up record time manually. Aren't you glad you have streaming services and videos on demand! The earliest know form of let's plays were hooking up your snes or even Sega genesis  and sharing with your friends how to play games by recording your playtime on vhs tapes lolz
